title: IEC (Import Export Code) Registration in India

sections.heading: What is an IEC?
content: The Ministry of Commerce & Industry's Directorate General of Foreign Trade (DGFT) issues a 10-digit Import Export Code (IEC). It is mandatory for anyone who wants to export or import goods and services in India.
Without an IEC, you cannot pass customs, receive payments from abroad, or claim export incentives. The code is linked to your PAN for life.

sections.heading: Why Do You Need an IEC?

points: Customs clearance for imports and exports
Registering on DGFT and ICEGATE portals
Valid for life, no renewal required
Builds trust with clients and partners

list.title: For Individuals
points: Aadhaar card, passport, or voter ID

list.title: For Companies, LLPs, and Firms
points: MOA & AOA, partnership deed, or LLP agreement
ID proof of directors or partners
Step 1: Fill out the online application on DGFT portal using PAN
Step 2: Upload KYC, bank details, and address proof
Step 4: IEC is issued electronically after verification
IEC is valid for life; no renewal required
Update IEC information annually on DGFT portal
Inform DGFT of any changes in business details
Comply with FEMA and RBI regulations
Do service exporters need an IEC? Yes, for both goods and services exports.
Can one IEC be used for multiple businesses? No, IEC is linked to a single PAN.
Is GST required for IEC? Not mandatory, but may be needed for certain export benefits.
Can IEC details be changed later? Yes, address, bank details, and directors can be updated online.
What if IEC is not used? Must still be updated annually.
Can IEC be transferred? No, IEC is non-transferable.
Is IEC required for selling on Amazon/Flipkart abroad? Yes.
